onset.Description: Onset of the event measured from the beginning of the acquisition of the first volume.

duration.Description: Duration of the event (measured from onset) in seconds.

trial_type.Description: Categorization of each trial as 'stimulus', 'catch' or 'blank'.

Levels.stimulus: The presented image belongs to one of the 150 multivariate RNC controlling images.
Levels.catch: The presented images depicts Buzz Lightyear, prompting the participant to press a button. The purpose of catch trials was to ensure participants paid attention to the stimuli.
Levels.blank: Fixation dot on a gray screen with no image presented.

stim_id.Description: Index indicating the ID of the presented image.

Levels.[1 150]: If trial_type is 'stimulus', stim_id indicates the index, in the range [1 150], of the presented multivariate RNC image. The first 50 images come from the V1 and V4 multivariate RNC alignment condition, the images from 50 to 100 come from the V1 and V4 multivariate RNC disentanglement condition, the images from 100 to 150 come from the V1 and V4 multivariate RNC baseline.
Levels.n/a: If trial_type is 'blank', no stim_id is assigned.

stim_file.Description: Represents the location of the stimulus image file presented at the given onset time.

stim_nsd_id.Description: If trial_type is 'stimulus', stim_nsd_id indicates the Natural Scenes Dataset index of the presented image (zero-based, in the range [0 72,999]).

button_press.Description: Value of participant's button press. Participants were instructed to press a button when a catch image was presented.
